Always go with your passions. Never ask yourself if it is realistic or not. —Deepak Chopra
Do one thing every day that scares you. —Eleanor Roosevelt
No need to hurry. No need to sparkle. No need to be anybody but oneself. ―Virginia Woolf
It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not. ―Andre Gide

For me, becoming is not about arriving somewhere or achieving a certain aim. I see it instead as forward motion, a means of evolving, a way to reach continuously toward a better self. The journey does not end. —Michelle Obama
And when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you achieve it. —Paulo Coelho
It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation. —Herman Melville
Be sure you put your feet in the right place, then stand firm. —Abraham Lincoln
Never let the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game. —Babe Ruth
To succeed in life, you need three things: a wishbone, a backbone, and a funnybone. —Reba McEntire
There is no perfection, only life. —Milan Kundera
You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough. —Mae West
Be where you are; otherwise you will miss your life. — Buddha
Whatever we are, whatever we make of ourselves, is all we will ever have—and that, in its profound simplicity, is the meaning of life. ―Philip Appleman
